author: Andrea Conti
title: Mimì vince X Factor 2024, la nuova Italia che avanza e la voce potente che ha sbaragliato tutti: ecco chi è
text:
Televisione Mimì vince X Factor 2024, la nuova Italia che avanza e la voce potente che ha sbaragliato tutti: ecco chi è Al quarto posto si è classificato Lorenzo Salvetti, terzi I Patagarri e secondi i Les Votives di Andrea Conti 5 Dicembre 2024 Commenti Mimì Caruso vince X Factor 2024 . Al quarto posto si è classificato Lorenzo Salvetti , terzi I Patagarri e medaglia d’argento a i Les Votives .
La 17enne proveniente da Usmate Velate, un piccolo centro vicino Monza, ha trionfato in Piazza Del Plebiscito a Napoli . Come spesso ha sottolineato Paola Iezzi è il simbolo della nuova Italia che avanza, quella dell’integrazione e dell’inclusione. Era anche l’unica donna arrivata in Finale . Entrata nella squadra di Manuel Agnelli , Mimì ha conquistato giudici e pubblico grazie alla voce unica e ha consentito al suo coach di vincere per la prima volta in sei edizioni in cui ha partecipato.
La musica per Mimì “è uno strumento per comunicare emozioni e fuggire dalle responsabilità di un mondo noioso” .
E non solo: “La musica è il mezzo più potente per abbattere barriere e condividere emozioni autentiche”.
Fin dall’inizio del talent, Mimì Caruso ha conquistato tutti e quattro i giudici con il suo stile, guadagnandosi un posto tra i 12 concorrenti ufficiali di stagione e poi tra i finalisti. Alle Audizioni, Mimì ha presentato una cover di “Figures” di Jessie Reyez. La sua interpretazione intensa ed emozionante ha spinto Manuel Agnelli a utilizzare il suo X Pass, garantendole l’accesso diretto ai Bootcamp. Ai Bootcamp e agli Home vist ha confermato il suo posto nel talent show.
“Dove si va” è l’inedito di Mimì, scritto da Madame e prodotto da Gianmarco Manilardi.
CLICCA IL MINUTO PER MINUTO DELLA DIRETTA DA NAPOLI
Con il suo Best Of Mimì ci ha fatto sorridere, emozionare e sognare #XF2024 pic.twitter.com/AMVTeH21tt
— X FACTOR (@XFactor_Italia) December 5, 2024
Napoli X-Factor Condividi questo articolo

author: Duaa Israr
title: Fond du Lac District Attorney warns Wisconsinites to visit their doctors after deadly health scare
text:
Fond du Lac District Attorney warns Wisconsinites to visit their doctors after deadly health scare
FOND DU LAC, Wis. (CBS 58) -- This New Year, make your well-being a priority -- that's the message Eric Toney wants people know.
In July, the Fond du Lac district attorney began experiencing health issues.
“Fever, chills, sweats, and then night sweats was what really put it over the edge where that’s just not normal," said Toney.
From there, his symptoms took a turn for the worse.
“I actually fell in the office where I had lost control of one of my legs for maybe 20 seconds and it cleared up," said Toney.
The problem was his heart.
"He was a young man who developed an infection in his aortic valve," said Dr. Thomas Hinkamp, a cardiothoracic surgeon with SSM Health St. Agnes Hospital.
Each heartbeat was more difficult than the one before.
“His heart was able to pump out blood, but the blood that he did pump out unfortunately, would drop right back into the heart," said Hinkamp. "His heart really wasn’t going to tolerate it for a long period of time.”
One visit turned into another and before he knew it, Toney was in the operating room.
“You’re going to need open heart surgery, so that was quite a whirlwind for me, I certainly wasn’t expecting it," said Toney.
Toney says while his situation may be rare, his message to others isn't.
“We can take our health for granted and that’s why it's so important to just make sure that when you’re seeing those symptoms, just check in with your doctor," said Toney.
Toney says he plans on starting the new year by running a 5k with his now-healthy heart.

author: archyworldyscom
title: Angélica Espinoza: Two-time Paralympic Champion in Paris 2024
text:
The Peruvian parataekwondo player wins her second consecutive Paralympic title, writing a new page in the history of the national sport. Angelica Espinoza He made history by becoming a two-time champion Paralympics at the Paris 2024 Games . The national parataekwondo player, who had already won the gold medal at Tokyo 2020, reaffirmed her dominance in the sport by once again achieving glory in the K44 (-47kg) category.
August 29, 2024 will be an unforgettable date for Angélica and for Peruvian sports. Her victory not only gave her a new gold medal, but also placed her on the same level as legendary paraswimmer Jimmy Eulert, who had achieved the same feat at the Atlanta and Sydney 2000 Games in 1996.
On her way to the final, Espinoza showed an undeniable superiority. In her first match, she defeated Cameroonian Guileine Chemogne with a resounding score of 28-9, which took her to the quarterfinals. There, she authoritatively defeated Iranian Maryam Abdollahpour 19-9, securing a place in the semifinals.
Read also:
Peruvian Para-athletes set out for Paris 2024 in pursuit of Paralympic medals
The semifinal was not played because her opponent, Naoual Laarif of Morocco, was unable to appear due to injury. This allowed Angelica to advance directly to the final, where she faced Ziyodakhon Isakova of Uzbekistan. In an exceptional performance, Espinoza won 10-4, thus obtaining her second gold medal at the Paralympics.
Angélica, who began her career in parataekwondo in 2017 and won her first gold medal at the 2019 Pan American Games in Lima, has shown that there are no limits for those who pursue their dreams with determination and passion.
In addition to Espinoza’s feat, other Peruvian paraathletes also achieved outstanding performances at Paris 2024. Paraswimmer Rodrigo Santillán earned a Paralympic diploma by finishing sixth in the S2 100-meter backstroke final. For their part, Daniella Campos, in paraarch, and Rubí Fernández, in parabadminton, also competed, but were unable to advance to the next rounds.
#Angélica #Espinoza #Twotime #Paralympic #Champion #Paris
2024-09-05 15:59:05

author: Syndication Cloud
title: New Leaf Family Welcomes Attorney Katie Wilmoth to Their Team | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
GOLDEN, Colorado, December 28, 2023— New Leaf Family is thrilled to announce the addition of attorney Katie Wilmoth to their growing team. As a skilled and compassionate family law attorney, Wilmoth brings a wealth of experience and dedication to the firm’s mission of providing exceptional legal representation in family law matters.
Christopher Anderson , CEO and founder of New Leaf Family, expressed his enthusiasm for the newest member of their team stating, “We are honored and excited to have Katie Wilmoth join the firm. She is an attorney of extraordinary talent, and caring for her clients. She will be an excellent addition to New Leaf’s team of attorneys seeking to empower our clients to make the best decisions for themselves and their families.”
With a focus on custody, child support, divorce, spousal support, property division, and modification of existing court orders, Katie has established herself as a strong advocate for her clients. She understands the unique challenges involved in cases involving children and recognizes the importance of helping parents work together for the benefit of their children even after legal proceedings have concluded. Katie firmly believes in leading by example, prioritizing professionalism, and encouraging her clients to consider the needs of their children above personal animosity towards the other parent.
Katie brings a valuable skill set to her family law practice, boasting an impressive background in business and a Bachelor of Science degree majoring in Economics from New York University – Leonard N. Stern School of Business. This background allows her to approach cases with a strategic mindset, evaluating not only the legal aspects but also the financial implications for her clients.
Rob Leitner, Chief Strategy Officer for New Leaf Family, noted that “Katie brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to the team. She is an outstanding advocate for her clients, and she continually demonstrates compassion and empathy.” Leitner added that “Katie has already made a significant impact on our legal team, and we are very excited about her future at the firm.”
Katie’s experience extends to handling high conflict cases, including those involving parental alienation, domestic violence, and alcohol and substance abuse. Her expertise in navigating complex and emotionally charged situations consistently guides her clients towards favorable outcomes, ensuring their rights and interests are protected throughout the legal process.
At New Leaf Family , the focus has always been on providing comprehensive and personalized legal services to individuals and families in need. Attorney Katie Wilmoth’s addition to the team further fortifies the firm’s commitment to excellence and strengthens their ability to serve clients facing challenging family law issues.
For more information about the legal services offered by New Leaf Family or to schedule a consultation with attorney Katie Wilmoth, please visit their website at www.newleaf.family or contact their office at (720) 712 – 3253.
New Leaf Family is a reputable law firm dedicated to providing compassionate and effective legal representation to individuals and families in and around Golden, CO. In addition to their client-centered approach, which empowers people to make decisions in their family’s best interest, New Leaf Family provides a variety of coaching and counseling services to assist clients at every stage of the process. They are committed to providing excellent legal services at fair costs as a dependable resource for local families.
The founders, Christopher T. Anderson and Penn Dodson, have been awarded Avvo 10.0 (Superb), and Martindale.com has rated the firm AV – Preeminent. Most important, however, are the clients who have experienced being a part of the New Leaf Family. See www.newleaf.family for more.
Media Contact:
Christopher Anderson
New Leaf Family
(720) 712 – 3253
christopher@newleaf.family

author: Redacción LAVOZ
title: La calentura de Santiago Longo por “algunas jugadas puntuales” en la caída de Belgrano
text: Santiago Longo terminó molesto con [la caída de Belgrano 2-3 frente a Lanús](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/deportes/futbol/errores-que-el-equipo-pago-con-una-derrota-las-claves-del-2-3-ante-lanus-por-la-liga-profesional/), pero más por algunas decisiones arbitrales. “En algunas jugadas puntuales... Para mi el primer gol de ellos fue off side, el penal que le hacen al Colo (por Juan Barinaga) fue penal... Después en la cancha el penal a Franco (Jara) no me pareció, pero la vi recién y pareció que lo toca justo... Lo que por ahí molesta es que ni revisen y que pasa rápido la jugada”, se quejó el capitán celeste. Longo siguió analizando la jugada del primer tanto de Lanús. “Le dije (al árbitro) que le sale de atrás a Nacho (Chicco), la pelota le va a él y salta... Para mi, participa de la jugada. Te dicen que lo chequean... Me da bronca que si dentro de la cancha cobran, después te dicen que no es claro, por qué cambia”, insistió el volante. “Ahora hay que cambiar el chip rápido. El lunes tenemos un partido complicadísimo en Alberdi (contra Godoy Cruz), ojalá que podamos volver a ganar de local, que nos estamos haciendo fuerte y eso es importante”, completó Longo en diálogo con 351 Deportes.
